House that morning by Colin Powell and White House Chief of Staff Howard Baker . Howard Baker told us that a treaty on strategic nuclear weapons was possible, but not probable in the remaining months of the Ronald Reagan administration. The president wants a good treaty, not a fast one, Howard Baker said.( What might Ronald Reagan have thought when our recent lame duck Congress rushed through a similar treaty last December?)
